newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian stocks nudge lower in moderate trade.
newsitem.headline: Croatian stocks nudge lower in moderate trade.

text.p: Croatian stocks nudged lower on Tuesday in moderate trade with corrections almost across the board for issues which rose steeply over the past month.
* Seven of 12 active stocks fell, four rose and one ended flat.
* Volume dipped to 12,832 units, turnover to 7.1 million kuna.
* Biggest loser was Adriatic pipeline operator Janaf, down 1,900 kuna to 7,000 with eight shares sold.
* Top gainer hotelier Istraturist rose 15 kuna or 7.89 percent on volume of 338 shares.
* Podravka was the most actively traded issue with 3,878 units. It lost two kuna to close at 318.
* Blue chip Pliva pharmaceuticals added two kuna to 490 on volume of 1,330 shares.
* Zagrebacka Banka ordinaries fell 10 kuna to 1,860 with 1,306 units traded. -- Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
